attributes.action: Cut Fuel Duty to enable a retail price of £1 per litre for diesel and petrol and stop VAT on Gas and electricity
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Enough is enough!

Since October 2007 when the price breached the £1 a litre mark prices have steadily risen. Petrol is now around £1.20 a litre and diesel £1.30...20% and 30% rises in 6 months?!

We've had enough and the government has raked in enough!!!

Scrapping the VAT on Petrol and diesel would enable a retail price of around £1 per litre for petrol with over half still going to governments coffers. A reduction of a further 10p in duty would bring diesel in line and give our transport industry a much needed competitive edge (the inducstry is in a vital cog in our economy surely?).

Duty has not discouraged car use (the lack of affordable reliable public transport has) so the argument of taxing fuel as a deterrent is a complete red herring.

We already pay tax on our meagre salaries!!! And we get hit twice with the cost of transport affecting household good prices.

As a necessity, it is a disgrace that gas and electircity carry any taxation at all. Taxation on fuel causes fuel poverty. VAT on fuel should be scrapped now and a harder line taken with the energy companies with a maximum mark up on wholesale prices enforced.

Are you listening No 10??
